      Attempts to add a new admin to the HashMap of all admins All usernames are unique (including between admins and users) Returns the HashMap if the admin successfully created Throw error if there's another admin with the same username.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AdminManager

        public AdminManager(java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Admin> adminHashMap,
                    java.util.ArrayList<Message> adminMessagesArrayList)
        Class constructor. Takes in HashMap of all admin accounts and ArrayList of Messages shared between all of them.
        Parameters:
        adminHashMap - HashMap containing all admin accounts.
        adminMessagesArrayList - ArrayList containing all admin Messages.

    • Method Detail

      • addAdmin

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Admin> addAdmin(Admin toAdd)
                                                   throws InvalidUsernameException
        Attempts to add a new admin to the HashMap of all admins All usernames are unique (including between admins and users) Returns the HashMap if the admin successfully created Throw error if there's another admin with the same username. Put this method in a try-catch!!!
        Parameters:
        toAdd - Admin object who we want to add to the HashMap of all admins.
        Returns:
        the new HashMap containing the new Admin
        Throws:
        InvalidUsernameException - username is already taken

      • addAdmin

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Admin> addAdmin(java.lang.String username,
                                                          java.lang.String password)
                                                   throws InvalidUsernameException
        adds a particular admin to the HashMap of all admins given a username and password String input
        Parameters:
        username - username of admin to be added
        password - password of admin to be added
        Returns:
        new HashMap with added admin
        Throws:
        InvalidUsernameException - if the username and password were wrong, throw this

      • getAdminMessagesArrayList

        public java.util.ArrayList<Message> getAdminMessagesArrayList()
        Attempts to retrieve Messages shared by all admin accounts.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of all Messages shared by all admin accounts.

      • setAdminMessagesArrayList

        public void setAdminMessagesArrayList(java.util.ArrayList<Message> adminMessagesArrayList)
        Attempts to set shared admin Messages by replacing previous one(s).
        Parameters:
        adminMessagesArrayList - shared admin Messages to replace previous one(s).

      • addNewPassWord

        public boolean addNewPassWord(java.lang.String password1,
                              java.lang.String password2,
                              Admin admin)
        Attempts to change password of a specific admin by getting input of new desired password twice.
        Parameters:
        password1 - attempt 1 at entering new password
        password2 - attempt 1 at entering new password
        admin - admin who is attempting to get a new password
        Returns:
        True if successful password change (attempt 1 and attempt 2 are same), false otherwise.

      • login

        public boolean login(java.lang.String username,
                     java.lang.String password)
              throws InvalidLoginException
        verifies login is correct
        Parameters:
        username - username that admin logs in with
        password - password that admin logs in with
        Returns:
        True if username and password exist within the adminHashMap, False otherwise
        Throws:
        InvalidLoginException - throw this is password for a given username isn't valid.

      • getAdmin

        public Admin getAdmin(java.lang.String username)
        returns the admin with the specified username
        Parameters:
        username - of the particular admin
        Returns:
        the Admin with the specified username
